page.title: 05FARMING NEAR TOWEDNACK
page.content: Mr & Mrs G Thomas Bussow Farm. This couple in their thirties, with two sons, run a dairy farm of 180 acres.They come from farming families and enjoy milking, tending calves and hay making.They use a{tractor, {hayturner}and a{baler. The granite built{farmhouse}is 150 years old, originally owned by Mr Thomas's father,it was modernised 14 years ago, when a new bathroom was installed.They heat the house with an {open fire}and a{solid fuel oven,}also they have{storage heaters}fuelled by electricity.The Thomas family grow their own vegetables and obtain their {provisions}weekly from Penzance; they use a freezer for food storage. They have good{communications consisting of a telephone and a car, essential for taking part in village events 2 miles distant.
